1.title: Apple's Eddy Cue
1.plot: Eddy Cue, Apple's Senior Vice President of Internet Software and Services, stops by the Callaway Live Studio to chat about his time at Apple, leading one of the most innovative companies in the world, how he finds time to work on his game, and a ton more.

2.title: Sergio Garcia
2.plot: Sergio Garcia, the newest Callaway staffer, stops by the Callaway Live Studio to chat about joining the Callaway team, winning the 2017 Masters, and so much more.

3.title: Bill Simmons
3.plot: Bill Simmons, longtime sports writer, author and founder of The Ringer, stops by the Callaway Live Studio for an exclusive interview to chat about the evolving habits of content consumption, digital trends and his upcoming documentary "Andre The Giant," which premieres on HBO April 10.

4.title: Xander Schauffele
4.plot: 2017 PGA Tour Rookie of the Year Xander Schauffele stops by the Callaway Live Studio to chat about his goals for the 2018, equipment changes, shooting 66 at the US Open, and so much more.

5.title: Jeremy Andrus
5.plot: Jeremy Andrus, CEO of Traeger Grills, stops by the Callaway Live studio to chat about what makes Traeger unique, what drew him to the company, and much more.

6.title: Mike Whan
6.plot: The LPGA Commish drops by Callaway Live to dish on the current state of the women's game, including why their players have embraced social media so well, potential Rules changes, the toughest aspects of his job, welcoming bigger crowds and sponsors, and a ton more.

7.title: Tom Watson
7.plot: 8-time major champion, Tom Watson stops by the Callaway Live studio to chat about winning the Par 3 Contest at Augusta, his first experience playing links golf, and much more.

8.title: Carl's Golfland
8.plot: We took Callaway Live on the road to Detroit, Michigan to sit down with Carl E. Rose, CEO of Carl's Golfland, to chat about their keys to their success, their influence on Michigan golf, and much more.

9.title: Kaitlyn Bristowe
9.plot: You know her from Season 11 of The Bachelorette, but now you can get a little more personal with Kaitlyn Bristowe and fiancé Shawn Booth as they let their guard down on the set of Callaway Live.

10.title: Bryce Kenny
10.plot: We bring Monster Jam to the Callaway Live studio when monster truck superstar Bryce Kenny, aka the Mohawk Warrior, stops by to chat with host Harry Arnett. Bryce opens up about his path to monster truck racing, his introduction to the game of golf, and even puts his driving skills to the test on set with Harry.

11.title: Rob Light
11.plot: Rob Light, managing partner and head of music at Creative Artists Agency (CAA) joins Harry on the Callaway Live set to chat about what it's like to drive the world's leading sports and entertainment agency. From discovering the band 21 Pilots in a small New York club to playing golf with Mark Wahlberg at Riviera, Rob opens up about some of his experiences being immersed in the entertainment industry.

12.title: Vince Gill
12.plot: Country Music Legend (and scratch golfer), Vince Gill, stops by the Callaway Live studio to chat with Harry about his childhood golf course in Crescent, Oklahoma, growing up in a musically gifted family, and much more. The 2-time Grammy Award winner also performs one of his original songs for the audience.

1.title: Dick Enberg
1.plot: Dick Enberg is one of the most recognizable sports broadcasters. His trademark "Oh, my!" has graced iconic moments in sports, from Augusta to 9 Super Bowls. Callaway Live debuted on 5/18/15 with the legendary sportscaster.

3.title: Geoff Shackelford
3.plot: Geoff is one of the most well-known and well-respected figures in golf media. Whether he's writing for Golf World, Golf Digest or his blog, or on-air with Golf Channel, he's always entertaining and engaging in the way he covers the game.

4.title: Will Kiersky
4.plot: In the fourth episode of Callaway Live, VICE Sports publisher Will Kiersky offers his take on all things golf and sports culture.

5.title: Tim Brando
5.plot: FOX Sports broadcaster Tim Brando discusses his career, his golf game, and covering the U.S. Open.

6.title: John O'Donnell
6.plot: Harry Arnett interviews the founder and designer of the lifestyle apparel brand johnnie-O, John O'Donnell.

7.title: Jon Leiberman
7.plot: Harry Arnett sits down with Emmy Award-winning reporter, host and producer Jon Leiberman from the Howard Stern Show.

8.title: Shane Bacon
8.plot: Shane has written for sports news outlets including AOL, Yahoo.com, CBS news, and most recently joined Fox Sports in covering USGA events.He spent the U.S. Open and U.S. Senior Open calling play-bay-play action on their live steams.

9.title: Mark Crossfield
9.plot: During Open Championship week at Callaway Live we only thought it was fitting that we bring out THE Ask Golf Guru Mark Crossfield.

10.title: Molly Solomon
10.plot: This was a special Callaway Live event because we were at the HOME OF GOLF (yeah that one), and naturally an epic location calls for an appropriate guest. Joining us live in St Andrews was Golf Channel Executive Producer, Molly Solomon.

11.title: Alan Mulally
11.plot: To bring you inside the business world, there's no better golfer and leader to have on the set of Callaway Live (literally, there might not be) than former Ford Motor Company CEO Alan Mulally.

12.title: Buddy Marucci
12.plot: Nearing the mid-way point in the inaugural season of Callaway Live, we kept the string of awesome guests coming as we sat down with one of the great amateur golfers of all time, Buddy Marucci.

13.title: Paige Spiranac
13.plot: If you've been on the Internet over the last few years, chances are you've heard of Paige Spiranac. We had her on the show to discuss creating viral social content, her start in golf and ultimately her aspiration of making the LPGA Tour.

14.title: Joel Klatt
14.plot: Former record-breaking University of Colorado QB, Joel Klatt, dropped by the Callaway Live studio to tell us all about his gig calling college games for Fox Sports. He also mentioned a thing or two about his growing addiction to golf.

16.title: Alan Shipnuck
16.plot: When it comes to sports publications there may be none that are in the same league as Sports Illustrated. When we heard that Alan Shipnuck, SI's go-to-guy for anything golf was joining us on Callaway Live we were pretty pumped.

17.title: Amanda Balionis
17.plot: Amanda Balionis was the host of several digital properties on PGATOUR.com, including "Trending on Tour." She's a popular presence on social media and built a reputation as one of the leading voices in the professional game.

18.title: Iration
18.plot: The band Iration blew away a packed studio audience with four incredible songs during an episode of Callaway Live. It was an MTV Unplugged-like setting that has yet to be replicated by any other guest.

19.title: Gary Williams
19.plot: One of the stars of Golf Channel's "Morning Drive," Williams brought his wealth of golf knowledge and laid back personality to the show and had some interesting things to say about golf's (potential) new Golden Age.

20.title: John Ashworth
20.plot: He created one of the most recognizable clothing brands in golf and is restoring Goat Hill Golf Course in Oceanside, CA.John Ashworth is a well-known, respected name in the sport.His brand Linksoul combines his passions of golf and surfing.

21.title: Ryan Sheckler
21.plot: One of the most recognizable action sports athletes on the planet and a die hard golfer, San Clemente, CA native Ryan Sheckler dropped by Callaway Live for a casual chat about his golf game, skateboarding, and his charitable foundation.

22.title: Irving Azoff
22.plot: Irving Azoff is a big deal in the music industry. He's the former CEO of Ticketmaster and personal manager to singers and groups like Maroon 5, the Eagles, and Christina Aguilera.He's obsessed with golf and travels around the world to play.

24.title: David Novak
24.plot: Before Novak became Exec. Chairman of Yum. Brands, he served as CEO for over 15 years. He's one of the biggest names in business and he just so happens to love golf AND Callaway Live. He joined us for our season 1 finale.

1.title: Phil Mickelson
1.plot: To start off Season 2 of Callaway Live, we thought it'd only be appropriate to bring on a heavy hitter. We welcomed five-time major champion and World Golf Hall of famer, Phil Mickelson.

2.title: Jimmy Dunne
2.plot: Prominent Investment Banker Jimmy Dunne shares stories of his amateur golf career, how golf and September 11th, 2001 intersected and profoundly impacted him, and he displayed a few fun examples of his oversized personality.

4.title: Morgan Pressel
4.plot: LPGA star Morgan Pressel stopped by Callaway Live to talk about her goals this season, being a tour veteran, and her foundation.

5.title: Adam Levine and Hank Haney
5.plot: Callaway motored up to the Fabulous Forum in LA to visit Grammy award winning singer/songwriter, Maroon 5 frontman, coach on NBC's The Voice, and golf fanatic Adam Levine! He was also joined by his swing coach and Callaway staff member Hank Haney, as well as Season 1 guest and music industry mogul Irving Azoff.

6.title: Evan Geiselman
6.plot: Surfing and competing since the age of 7 and now 21 years old, Evan Geiselman has been recognized as one of the best young surfers in the world. His smooth and explosive style has given everyone a glimpse into his promising future. But when he's not in the lineup, he's on the golf course almost 100% of the time honing his game.

7.title: Shackhouse
7.plot: The No. 1 sports podcast tandem (according to iTunes) of Geoff and Joe House join us at Callaway HQ to discuss the early success of their golf podcast "Shackhouse," how it all came together and what we can expect in the next few months.

8.title: Ted Bishop
8.plot: Ted Bishop the 38th President of the PGA of America and Director of Golf at the Legends Golf Club dropped by the Callaway Live studios for the first stop on his book tour for his new book "Unfriended" which explores his time as the President of the PGA.

9.title: Ed Stack
9.plot: During US Open week we thought, why not pop out to Pittsburgh and for a Callaway Live in the host city? A little over 20 miles from the US Open venue is Dick's Sporting Good Headquarters and we sat down with Ed Stack the Chairman & CEO of Dick's and President of Oakmont CC! Ed has been CEO of Dick's since 1984 and has seen the company grow from 2 stores in New York to over 500 across the country.

10.title: Aaron Wise
10.plot: Aaron Wise had a lot going on in the summer of 2016. First, he won the NCAA individual title. Then he led the Oregon to a team victory in the NCAA championships. The following week he won medalist honors in US Open sectional qualifying, securing him a spot in the US Open. Oh and he just so happens to be one of Callaway's newest staff professionals so we were thrilled to welcome Aaron to Callaway Live.

11.title: Gil Hanse
11.plot: Renowned golf course architect Gil Hanse is one of the most popular names in the game. We were thrilled to have Gil come to Callaway Live and chat about how he started his career, some of his favorite projects, and his philosophy on golf course design.

12.title: Rich Eisen
12.plot: One of the most popular sports personalities of the last 20 years, Rich Eisen graced us with his presence on the set of Callaway Live to talk football, his new show, connecting with his fans and even challenged Amanda Balionis to a 40-yard chip-off.

13.title: Jamie Sadlowski
13.plot: 2-time World Long Drive champion Jamie Sadlowski joined us on Callaway Live to share his history of smashing 400 yard drives and to fill us in on a VERY important announcement.

14.title: Seamus Golf
14.plot: Akbar and Megan Chisti are meticulous designers of golf head covers and accessories that are crafted to represent each individual golfer, their passion for the game, and their distinct style. This year at the US Open their crafted metal church pew bunkers bottle opener was the hottest item at the tournament gift shops. We are thrilled to welcome them to Callaway Live!

15.title: Greg Maddux
15.plot: This show is of particular significance in Callaway's two season history because our host Harry Arnett, a lifelong Braves fan, is sitting down with one of his favorite athletes of all time. We are of course talking about 4-Time NL Cy Young award winner, MLB Hall of Famer, and Braves great, Greg Maddux.

16.title: Herm Edwards
16.plot: The outspoken NFL analyst dropped by the studio and opened up about what kind of golfer he is, his best stories from his playing days, and the origins of his famous "HELLO! YOU PLAY TO WIN THE GAME!" press conference.

17.title: Chris Harrison
17.plot: You've seen him on The Bachelor, The Bachelorette, Miss America, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire and much more, now watch Chris Harrison put his guard down and have some fun on Callaway Live.

18.title: Sean Toulon
18.plot: Sean Toulon, founder of Toulon Design and golf industry veteran, is the newest member of the Callaway Golf team and shares his vast knowledge of how the industry has changed, trends he sees going forward and how Toulon Design will coincide with Odyssey Golf.

19.title: Brad "Scarface" Jordan
19.plot: Brad Jordan, AKA Scarface, joins Callaway Live to talk about his starring role in Callaway's newly released short film "Golf Lives." The hip hop legend also talks about how he got hooked on the game and what he's working on in the studio.

20.title: James Blake
20.plot: Tennis and golf often go hand-in-hand and former tennis star James Blake is a HUGE Callaway fan and has been close with us for a while. Known for his speed and power on the tennis court and a quick wit to boot it was awesome to have him at headquarters for the show.

21.title: Keith Jackson
21.plot: Keith Jackson has spent a lifetime in the booth for ABC Sports and came by Callaway Live to share his best stories, including the origins of his famous "Whoa, Nellie!" call.

22.title: Adam Rapoport
22.plot: Adam Rapoport comes by the Callaway Live studio to talk about the best food to have on the golf course, what the ultimate burger should look like, and even gives a live demonstration on how to create an amazing halfway house grilled chicken sandwich.

1.title: Jim Furyk
1.plot: Callaway Live is back for Season Three. Complete with new guests and a brand-new studio. And in typical Callaway Live fashion we are getting things started with a bang. PGA Tour pro Jim Furyk joins Harry Arnett to discuss his recent appointment as the 2018 US Ryder Cup Captain.

2.title: Mike Tirico
2.plot: One of the most popular sports broadcasters in the world, Mike Tirico drops by the Callaway Live studio to chat about his new role covering the Olympics for NBC, his love of the game, and some of the best events he's ever covered.

3.title: Adam Hadwin
3.plot: Adam Hadwin is having an Epic 2017 season. He shot a 59, just won the Valspar Championship, and he's about to get married. Now he joins Callaway Live to chat all about his success, winning on all levels and growing up a golfer in Canada.

4.title: Michelle Wie and Iration
4.plot: The 2014 U.S. Women's Open champ drops by Callaway Live and is joined by the popular alternative/reggae band Iration.

5.title: Luke Wilson
5.plot: You know him as The Godfather from "Old School" (among many other roles), now get to know Luke Wilson on a more personal level when he drops by the Callaway Live studio.

6.title: Bill Macatee
6.plot: Bill Macatee is one of the most well-known and respected voices in golf. He's a legend in sports broadcasting, a master storyteller, a passionate golfer, and one of the nicest guys in the business.

7.title: Philip Bailey
7.plot: Philip Bailey is a longtime member of the legendary band Earth, Wind and Fire and now devotes a lot of his time off the stage to his golf game. Watch Philip share some amazing stories (both music and golf) live from The Forum in LA.

8.title: Dan Fouts
8.plot: Legendary San Diego Charger QB Dan Fouts stopped by the Callaway Live studio to share some of his best football memories and how golf has helped shape his life away from the field.

9.title: Jim D'Addario
9.plot: Jim D'Addario, current CEO of D'Addario (manufacturer of music equipment), stops by Callaway Live to talk about how D'Addario grew into a mega business, musical influences, and his game.

10.title: Geoff Yang
10.plot: Geoff co-founded Redpoint in 1999 and has backed trailblazing consumer and communications platform companies from their founding including Arista, Ask.com, Bluefin, Calix, Efficient Frontier, Foundry Networks, Excite, Juniper Networks, MySpace, and TiVo. He currently serves on the boards of Redpoint portfolio companies Electric Imp, Machinima, Scribd, TasteMade, and Victorious. He also serves on the boards of AT&T, Esquel Group, and Franklin Resources (Franklin Templeton Funds).

11.title: James Davis
11.plot: Up-and-coming comic James Davis, who has a show debuting on Comedy Central called Hood Adjacent, grew up in LA and became hooked on the game at an early age. He dropped by The Forum to share his hilarious and unique golf stories from growing up.

12.title: Dan Patrick
12.plot: Dan Patrick joins Harry Arnett on Callaway Live to talk everything from his days at ESPN, to his philosophy on creating content and of course his passion for the game of golf.

13.title: Matt Ryan
13.plot: On Callaway Live we love surprises. That's why we surprised our host Harry Arnett with his hometown hero. That's right, the reigning NFL MVP and Quarterback of the Atlanta Falcons Matt Ryan.

14.title: Atlanta Braves Edition
14.plot: Callaway Live welcomes Atlanta Braves Chairman Terry McGuirk and Liberty Media (company who owns the Braves) CEO Greg Maffei to chat about using golf as a business tool, rebuilding the Braves organization, and the keys to running a successful company.

15.title: Brian Niccol
15.plot: In this can't miss episode of Callaway Live, Taco Bell CEO Brian Niccol drops by to chat about how Taco Bell is innovating in the social/digital space, how new products are added to the menu and what it's like to have a meal at their HQ test kitchen.

16.title: Mike Hinkley, Green Flash Brewery
16.plot: Mike Hinkley, Founder and CEO of Green Flash Brewery in San Diego, comes by the Callaway Live studio to talk about how he started Green Flash, how he got it so big so fast, and the one instrumental beer that made it all happen.

17.title: Reggie Bush
17.plot: Former NFL and USC star running back Reggie Bush came by Callaway Live studio to dish on the toughest aspects of playing in the NFL, his insane training regiment, his fast-improving golf game and much more.

18.title: Phil Kenyon
18.plot: Odyssey Staff Professional Phil Kenyon is the putting instructor of some of the world's best golfers (Henrik Stenson, Rory McIlroy, Alex Noren, Justin Rose) and shares some of his best advice/Tour stories with Harry and the live audience at Callaway HQ.

19.title: MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred
19.plot: In between team visits on the west coast, MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred dropped by Callaway HQ for a lively chat about how the MLB is shifting with new technology, keeping fans engaged during broadcasts, and arguments for/against a proposed pitch clock.

20.title: Travis Brasher and Ryan Ellis of TravisMathew
20.plot: TravisMathew CEO Travis Brasher and President Ryan Ellis stopped by the Callaway Live studio to chat about how they started the company, NOT chasing trends and if the "OG" polo is still in.

imdb.title: Callaway Live
plot: _Callaway Live_ (qv) gives consumers access to unscripted moments with celebrities, athletes and tour players talking about golf, life and presumably everything in between in front of a studio audience.::Ethan Ganot
